responses.content:
Here is the YAML output identifying the security vulnerabilities in the codebase:

```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) attacks, as it does not properly sanitize or escape user-provided input before displaying it on the web page. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious script into the page, which would then be executed by the user's browser, potentially compromising their session or stealing sensitive data.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - clickAccept
      - clickRefuse
    filenames:
      - oidc-test/oidc-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/test/po/OIDCProviderConsentPage.java
  - headline: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to arbitrary file upload attacks, as it does not properly validate the file type or contents before saving the user's avatar. This could allow an attacker to upload a malicious file, which could be executed on the server or used to gain further access to the system.
    cwe: CWE-434
    function_names:
      - updateUser
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to OS command injection attacks, as it does not properly sanitize or validate the group names before using them in system commands. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious commands into the group management process, potentially gaining unauthorized access to the system.
    cwe: CWE-78
    function_names:
      - addUserToXWikiGroup
      - removeUserFromXWikiGroup
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to information disclosure, as it stores sensitive information (such as the access token and ID token) in the user session, which could be accessed by an attacker with access to the session data. This could allow an attacker to gain unauthorized access to the user's account or perform actions on their behalf.
    cwe: CWE-200
    function_names:
      - setAccessToken
      - setIdToken
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCClientConfiguration.java
  - headline: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to clickjacking attacks, as it does not properly restrict the rendering of the OIDC consent page within an iframe or other UI layer. This could allow an attacker to trick a user into interacting with the consent page, potentially granting unauthorized access to their account.
    cwe: CWE-1021
    function_names:
      - clickAccept
      - clickRefuse
    filenames:
      - oidc-test/oidc-test-pageobjects/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/test/po/OIDCProviderConsentPage.java
  - headline: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to data exposure, as it does not encrypt the sensitive data (such as the access token and ID token) stored in the user session. This could allow an attacker with access to the session data to gain unauthorized access to the user's account or perform actions on their behalf.
    cwe: CWE-311
    function_names:
      - setAccessToken
      - setIdToken
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCClientConfiguration.java
  - headline: Incorrect Default Permissions
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to unauthorized access, as it does not properly set the default permissions on the user's document. This could allow other users or processes to access or modify the user's information without authorization.
    cwe: CWE-276
    function_names:
      - getNewUserDocument
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to unsafe reflection attacks, as it uses user-provided input to select and instantiate classes or code. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server or gain unauthorized access to sensitive information.
    cwe: CWE-470
    function_names:
      - getJSONElement
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Deserialization of Untrusted Data
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to deserialization attacks, as it deserializes user-provided data (such as the access token and ID token) without properly validating or sanitizing the input. This could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the server or gain unauthorized access to sensitive information.
    cwe: CWE-502
    function_names:
      - parse
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/NimbusOIDCIdToken.java
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/NimbusOIDCUserInfo.java
  - headline: Insufficient Verification of Cryptographic Signature
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to signature verification attacks, as it does not properly verify the signature of the ID token before using it. This could allow an attacker to forge or tamper with the ID token, potentially gaining unauthorized access to the user's account or performing actions on their behalf.
    cwe: CWE-347
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Improper Certificate Validation
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to certificate validation attacks, as it does not properly validate the SSL/TLS certificates used in the OIDC communication. This could allow an attacker to perform man-in-the-middle attacks and gain unauthorized access to the user's data or account.
    cwe: CWE-295
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/OIDCAuthServiceImpl.java
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java
  - headline: Improper Validation of Integrity Check Value
    analysis: |
      The code is vulnerable to integrity check validation attacks, as it does not properly validate the integrity of the data received from the OIDC provider (such as the ID token). This could allow an attacker to tamper with the data and gain unauthorized access to the user's account or perform actions on their behalf.
    cwe: CWE-354
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - oidc-authenticator/src/main/java/org/xwiki/contrib/oidc/auth/internal/OIDCUserManager.java

classification: slightly promising
```
